Text.Page:
Grandpa gave me this map. "Avil," he'd say, "this map shows exactly where Baracos, Lord of the Labyrinth, keeps his treasures."

My sister said that Grandpa would say almost anything to get us to bed, but she's a bitter hag. I believe!

You're going deep into the Golden Labyrinth. Can you keep an eye out for these hidden treasures?"You don't want to come?"

Thank you, no. When I was a kid, my sister once threw me down a well, and there were baby caimans at the bottom.

Ever since then, I can't stand anything scaly.

I'd be a wreck before we got inside the door, .
(Old sundries, disintegrating bandages, and a rusty dagger. All worthless.)
(A faintly glowing bracelet lies amid some chunks of wood.)
A rusty dagger and a shiny bracelet? Maybe Grandpa was spinning tales after all.
